msContents.summary: Grant deva-bhoga with the eigteen exemptions of the village of Uruvupalli to the temple of Viṣṇuhāradeva, built by the general Viṣṇuvarman, at Kaṇḍukūra, for the increase of life and force.

div.head: Plates
div.p:
1
jitaṃ bhagavatā śrī-vijaya-palakkaḍa-sthānāt parama-brahmaṇyasya sva
bāhu-balārjitorjita-kṣātra-tapo-nidheḥ vihita-sarvva-maryyādasya
sthiti-sthitasyāmitātmano mahārajasya śrī-skandavarmmaṇaḥ
prapautrasyārccita-śakti-siddhi-sampannasya pratāpopanata-rāja
maṇḍalasya mahārājasya vasudhā-talaika-vīrasya śrī-vīravarmmaṇaḥ pau
trasya deva-dvija-guru-vṛddhopacāyino vivṛddha-vinayasyāneka-go-hi
raṇya-bhūmy-ādi-pradānaiḥ pravṛddha-dharmma-sañcayasya prajā-pālana
dakṣasya loka-pālānāṃ pañcamasya loka-pālasya satyātmano mahā
2
tmano mahārājasya śrī-skandavarmmaṇaḥ putrasya bhagavad-bhakti-sadbhāva
saṃbhāvita-sarvva-kalyānṇasya prajā-saṃrañjana-paripālanodyoga-sata
ta-satra-vrata-dita-kṣitasyadīkṣitasya Aneka-samar-sāhasāvamardda-la
bdha-vijaya-yaśaḥ-prakāśasya kali-yuga-doṣāvasanna-dharmmoddharaṇa-nitya-sa
nnaddhasya rāja-rṣi-guṇa-sarvva-sandoha-vijigīśor ddharmma-vijigīṣor bhagavat-pādā
nuddhyātasya bappa-bhaṭṭāraka-mahārāja-pāda-bhaktasya parama-bhāgavatasya
bhāradvāja-sagotrasya sva-vikkramākrāntānya-nṛpa-śrī-nilayānām yathaā
vad āhṛtāśvamedhaānām pallavānām dharmma-yuvamahārāja-śrī-viṣṇugopava
3
rmmaṇo vacanena muṇḍarāṣṭre Uruvupalliye grāmeyakāḥ vaktavyāḥ Etasmin grāma
sīme dviśataṃ sima-nivarttanāni Eteṣāṃ nivarttanānām Avadhayaḥ Apa
raṃ diśi kaṇḍukūra-grāmasya sīmāvadhiḥ dakṣiṇaṃ diśi suprayoga-nadī
Avadhiḥ pūrvvān diśi Avadhiḥ pūrvva-dakṣiṇākottaraṃ mahāpathapārśve śilā
Etasyāḥ Uttaraṃ gatvā ciñcavṛkṣaḥ tataḥ Uttaraṃ gatvā kurupūra-grāmasya kaṇḍukū
ra-grāmasya ca pathi śilā tataḥ Uttaraṃ gatvā śilopalayam tataḥ Uttaraṃ ga
tvā karupūra-grāme braāhmaṇānām hala-kṣetrasyāvadhau śilā Uttarāṃdi
śi Avadhiḥ śilopalayavṛto mahāciñcavṛkṣaḥ tataḥ Aparadiśaṃ gatvā
4
koṇḍamuruvudu-grāmasya sīmāntam avadhiḥ Evaṃ caturṇām sīmāvadhīnāṃ maddhye sī
masya tadviśata nivarttanāni kaṇḍukūre viṣṇu-varmma-senāpati-kṛta-viṣṇuhāra-devaku
lāya deva-bhogaṃ kṛtvā Aṣṭādaśa-jātibhiḥ parihārair upetā Asmad-āyur-bala
varddhanīyam asmābhiḥ sampradattaṃ tad avagamya tasmin viṣaye sarvvāyuktakāḥ sarvvanaiyyokāḥ
rājavallābhāḥ sañcarantakāś ca tatsīmam sarvvapairihāraiḥ pariharantu parihārayantu ca
yaś cedam asmac-chāsanam atikrāmet sa pāpaś śārīradaṇḍam arhati Api cārṣa-ślokāḥ
bhūmi-dānāt paran dānaṃ na bhuūtan na bhaviṣyati tasyaiva haraṇa-pāpa na bhūta na bhaviṣyati
sva-dattā para-dattāṃ vā yo hareta vasundhuarām gavāṃ śata-sahasrasya hantuḫ pibati du
ṣkṛtam
siṃhavarmma-māahārājasya vijayasaṃvatsare Ekādaśe pauṣyamāse kṛṣṇapakṣe
daśamyām mayā dattā tāṃpratāmra-paṭṭikā

app.note: The word śrī could be considered a second auspicious opening formula (see translations by Fleet 1876, Brocquet 1997), but it appears to be an honorific prefix to the issuing placename as in vijaya-śrī-palakkaḍa-sthānāt tfaPallava007 and śrīmad-vijaya-daśanapurādhiṣṭ[h*]ānāt tfaPallava247.
The vowel i in rcci, which is postcript, is perfectly round and shows no inclusion of a repha.
The anusvāra in saṃ is above the next character.
IP propose saṃrakṣaṇa, mais rejeté comme non nécessaire par Brocquet (1997 : 378n503)
Generally corrected by editiors to satya, but unnecessary. See Francis ****
This correction of the text is unnecessary.
The ā in tā is very slightly engraved due to the proximity of the binding hole.
The anusvāra at the end of °dattāṃ is above the next character.
